metadata.Title: CVE-2012-5642 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
server/action.py in Fail2ban before 0.8.8 does not properly handle thecontent of the matches tag, which might allow remote attackers to triggerunsafe behavior in a custom action file via unspecified symbols in thiscontent.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5642` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

fail2ban - 0.8.10-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fail2ban package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.10-1').
